text: MALIGNANT HYPERTHERMIA: Acute management (for full management see wall guide) (Tachycardia, NCO2, Muscle rigidity, Masseter spasm or trismus, Acidosis, A\ Temperature, Myoglobinuria) * Callfor help * Discontinue all potential triggers (volatiles and suxamethonium) & change anaesthetic machine or use oxygen directly from a wall outlet * Hyperventilate * 100% oxygen * Dantrolene: 2.5mg/kg bolus every 5 minutes until signs of MH are reversed (up to 30mg/kg) » Sodium bicarbonate 8.4% : 1ml/kg if blood gas not available yet <5kg: BE x weight (kg)/4 =mls >5kg: BE x weight (kg)/ 6 =mls Adult: BE x weight (kg)/ 10 = mls * Cool patient if temperature >39°C, stop cooling once <38°C * Monitor for hyperkalaemia and dysrhythmias Do NOT use calcium channel blockers (risk of hyperkalemia and arrest in the presence of dantrolene) * Insert catheter and monitor urine output (aim >0.5ml/kg/hr) If urine output less than 0.5ml/kg/hr consider diuresis with furosemide (1mg/kg) or mannitol (0.25g/kg)
